WRITING.TEXT: The other day my arm had radiating pain shooting from my fingertips down to my elbow. I perked up, hoping for blood poisoning (original point of pain was a cut). Nope. Just a damaged tendon, supposedly, according to google. Fuck me.

I always fantasize in a shooter scenario, I demand to be shot and then die on the spot. I dunno if it will actually play out that way, but I wanna see my reaction. I don't secretly wish it would happen so I could reveal myself a hero, I just want to see if I had the chance I'd take it to be dead.
Wouldn't it be better to just go after veins?
Damn, you're right. I'll be waiting for the moment to speak up until the moment never comes and I'm kicking myself cause everyone was shot but me.

No, because I can't access guns. I don't know how I could possibly get a gun. And you're probably right anyway. I'll want to die until those 5min of self preservation kick in, and then I'll want to die again when it's over.
I made that plan! Decided I was done, made suicide plans. Failed like a loser. Doctors were like, why? I was like, I decided I was done. They didn't get it.

Passive suicide thoughts vs active ones. Active: I'm planning to jump in front of a bus. Passive: I'm not planning to take definitive action, but if a bus is coming towards me, I won't step out of the way.
I think he's just saying he can't relate, not that he's afraid of catching homosexuality.
Why not? I googled it to see if it was some fucked up horror or something, but it actually sounds kind of sweet?
He found the ultimate suicide spot. All natural, take a stroll, slowly get tired and have it all fade away

I have a bunch of burn scars and hands down the worst part was not the pain, not the appearance of the scars... Scar tissue doesn't sweat, so I'm fucking hot all the fucking time and constantly feel overheated at a mildly warm temperature. Not really a consequence you think about beforehand.
Super simple? Like, how so?
It is. My new norm is sweating in 70s and comfortable in the 30s. Can't wait for winter to come round again.

I went to their website and they say there's a global helium shortage. Edit: ok I found another part of the site that does seem to offer small tanks. Do you think a small tank would be enough? Edit edit: a lot of the reviews claim tanks were empty or not all the way full. Seems disappointingly unreliable.

Similar happened to my husky! My cousin was skipping rocks on some floating ice, she observed the rocks skittering and jumped to test the ice herself. Fell right through. Didn't see any side effects until she got stuck on a log this summer, afraid to jump into the water. She'll still wade, but won't jump.
I like that, that's an excellent idea.

Hard to describe. A lot of 1-2" burns. The worst are like... 5x3" maybe. It was after those bigger ones when I immediately noticed overheating. And that's true. I was in a "freezing cold" room everyone was complaining about, but I quite enjoyed the temp.

I think it depends on the 3 yr old. I remember when I was a little girl, I was SUPER self conscious being naked around adults. At this age, a kid should be given privacy and not have to experience being naked around any adult. If the kid didn't give a shit, she's still too young to care so it doesn't matter. If the kid is embarrassed, op shouldn't have bathed her. People are missing the point. The kid is the one you should look to, not the parents' opinion, unless they are specifically basing it off of their kid's reaction.
I feel like this sums up siblings. Like, we all wanna feel that vindication of the kid up top.
A kid from my high school posted asking for prayers and good vibes for his surgery. That was his final post. He died in surgery.

Before the pages used to be left up until family requested/proved the person died, then they would take them down. They started doing memorial pages sometime in like 2010. For the most part, people seem to take the page down entirely or just leave it be, though.
Yesss, I was hoping for an appearance of blowfly girl

The only experience I've had with dmt was this girl that came into the psych ward tripping balls. She was fucked up, man. Her fingernails said 420, and she came in on 4/21. She needed a 1-1 sitter because she wandered into other people's rooms and would just start touching people. She made no sense, couldn't sleep, couldn't eat, was in her own world for 2 more days straight. Talking to herself, singing and dancing and wandering around speaking gibberish. On the third day she started coming down, but was still out of it. That's when she muttered about tripping on dmt, then would scream like a psycho about how much pain she was in and call her mom begging and sobbing for relief. She apparently had the worst hangover in the world. I was like damnnn, imma not try that stuff ever. Maybe after 4 days she was finally aware of her surroundings. And she came in the day AFTER 4/20 so she was tripping for like 5 days straight.
It was heart surgery. Kid was born with a heart condition. His time left was very limited anyway.
It was heart surgery. Kid was born with a heart condition. His time left was very limited anyway.
His was open heart surgery. Hopefully yours is less intense? Good luck.
That's morbid. I have more than a few dead facebook friends, people post sad messages on their wall. That's sad nobody even knows he's dead tho. Damn.

I don't find it dismissive, but I don't understand the point of requesting good vibes. At least prayers is to a person's higher power and is based on a belief system. What's a good vibe gonna get you?

Eh, I think it's a personal thing. If someone believes in prayer and receives prayer, that will be a different result than someone who doesn't believe and is prayed for. That study sounded pretty random, the people receiving prayer were not specifically asking for it. I think that makes a difference
Yikes, well if you are a teen who was born with a heart condition then I don't know what to tell you except I hope your results are different.

Really makes you cringe when you think about scratching mosquito bites. Or anytime I've scratched near a needle site after having blood taken. And also how careful they are to make sure the site is clean, because on a microscopic level the hole that's left is huge. Imagine all the bacteria that would love to snuggle up in there.

Sometimes I get so sick of realistic as fuck nightmares every night, I think about how nice it would be to blow my brains out just for the sake of stopping the dreams. Being alive sucks enough, the fact there's no relief in sleep is agony.
Sometimes I wonder if death would be like an un-ending nightmare you could never wake up from.

Or so terrifying you wake up screaming. People apologize for waking me up because they say I always look so scared. It's because I'm constantly trapped in a nightmare and they wake me up from it. I tell them it's a GOOD thing they woke me up, not a bad thing. My scared response is a sign I was in a bad place ffs.

Can you really stab yourself in the jugular with a broken plastic fork? Most plastic utensils in psych are more bendy than stiff. They'll flex for days rather than shatter or break.

Like a butcher knife or a butter knife? I stole butter knives whilst in residential treatment, cos they were locked up so I thought they were "special." But butter knives are pretty worthless and painful and difficult to self harm with, let alone attempt suicide with.

Ahhhh!!! He's the reason I can't get decent bandages on the psych ward!!!! They're all like, nope, can't use this, can't use that... bandaging becomes a big pain in the ass while they apologize that they can't use certain materials for *reasons*. He's the reasons!!!

I felt like I was dying once, didn't state it out loud. Just kept mumbling that I felt like shit, just don't feel good. Nobody took me seriously til they tried to get me to walk to another room and I almost fell the moment I tried to stand. They sat me down and took my blood pressure, it had bottomed out and they rushed me back to the er.
I never made that statement because I was too close to dying to speak.

One time I was being wheeled in a stretcher to a psych hospital. They opened the door to let me in, and some dude charged the fuck out and grabbed the stretcher and said he needed to save me. A bunch of people grabbed him to yank him off of me. My paramedic was friggin pregnant trying to defend me lol. He knocked a hole in the wall with the doorknob, the patchwork was like a visible souvenir of my experience.

You've gotta be a man, because I hope no woman out there is flushing their sanitary products. Also, the question isn't really about life beginning at conception, most medical texts agree to this "idiotic" fact. It's about whether this life deserves human rights or not that is the question. The standard medical text Human Embryology and Teratology states, #8220;Although human life is a continuous process, fertilization is a critical landmark because, under ordinary circumstances, a new, genetically distinct human organism is thereby formed. #8221; Keith Moore and T.V.N Persaud #8217;s textbook The Developing Human states, #8220;Human life begins at fertilization #8221; Langman #8217;s Medical Embryology also states that, #8220;Development begins with fertilization. #8221; Finally, the fourth chapter of Scott Gilbert #8217;s textbook Developmental Biology is simply titled, #8220;Fertilization: Beginning of a New Organism. #8221; The philosopher David Boonin writes in his book **A Defense of Abortion**, #8220;[T]he most straightforward relation between you and me on the one hand and every human fetus on the other is this: All are living members of the same species, homo sapiens. A human fetus after all is simply a human being at a very early stage in his or her development. #8221; Pro-choice philosopher Peter Singer writes in his book Practical Ethics, #8220;there is no doubt that from the first moments of its existence an embryo conceived from human sperm and eggs is a human being. #8221;

I remember when my grandma shattered the coffee pot and I stepped on a piece of glass. It kept hurting despite no glass being in the wound. Turns out the glass had slid inside to the left. I had to slowly push and slide it out from under my skin. Yuck.
I always come to that same realization... even if my arms were miraculously scar free, I'd just work on fucking them up all over again.
